intro: Spiraea stellata, commonly known as the star spirea, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and features slender, arching stems covered in small, white to pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves that are dark green and turn yellow in the fall. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and prefers well-drained soil. Spiraea stellata is often used in ornamental gardening for its delicate, showy blooms and compact growth habit.
